sentences.sContent: “No birthday, ” she repeated, fingering the brooch on her breast.
sentences.sContent_eng: “No birthday, ” she repeated, fingering the brooch on her breast.
sentences.sCn: “没有生日”，她复述道，一边玩弄着胸口的胸针。

sentences.sContent: A lady with a large, sparkly spider brooch asks me what size I think she would take in a black dress she is admiring.
sentences.sContent_eng: A lady with a large, sparkly spider brooch asks me what size I think she would take in a black dress she is admiring.
sentences.sCn: 一位带着一枚大而闪亮的蜘蛛胸针的女士，正在欣赏着一件黑色的礼服，过来问我她能穿多大号的？

sentences.sContent: “Ultimately, we envision the camera becoming so small that it integrates into clothing, such as the button of a shirt, a brooch, or a pendant”, he said.
sentences.sContent_eng: “Ultimately, we envision the camera becoming so small that it integrates into clothing, such as the button of a shirt, a brooch, or a pendant”, he said.
sentences.sCn: 帕特里克说：“我们想象一下，如果这个摄影机非常小巧，我们就可以把它放进衣服里，像衬衫扣子、胸针、或是项链的坠子一样。”

trans.tranOther: a piece of jewellery that you fasten to your clothes, usually worn by women
